intro: Thibaudia archeri, commonly known as the golden trumpet or yellow bell, is a striking flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Thibaudia archeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for. It is also used in traditional medicine by some Indigenous Australian communities.
